guide.title: Installation Guide
guide.step1_desc: To activate the consent system on your site, you must include the banner.php file on every page. The ideal place is in the footer, right before the </body> closing tag.
guide.step1_note: This command will automatically load the CSS, JavaScript, and initialization logic for Google Consent Mode V2.
guide.step2_desc: The system includes a dynamic policy generator. You can create a privacy.php page and include the policy engine by pasting this code:
guide.step2_note: The engine automatically recognizes the user's language if passed as a parameter (e.g., privacy.php?lang=en) and replaces placeholders with company data saved in the Admin.
guide.step2_new_text: You can configure a custom URL in the Admin. In JSON translations, use the placeholder {{privacy_url}} to generate dynamic links.
guide.step3_desc: The system handles tracking in compliance with Consent Mode V2.
guide.step3_li1: If you enter the GA4 ID in the Admin, the system will automatically load the necessary scripts.
guide.step3_li2: IMPORTANT: If you previously inserted the Google Analytics code manually into your site, you must remove it to avoid conflicts and privacy violations.
guide.step3_warn: Please Note: Without consent, GA4 will only send anonymous signals (pings) without installing profiling cookies.
guide.step4_desc: You can modify the primary colors directly from the Admin panel with Live Preview. If you need deeper changes, you can override the CSS variables in your main stylesheet:
guide.step5_desc: To block scripts like Facebook Pixel or LinkedIn before consent, change their <script> tag to <script type='text/plain' data-category='marketing'>.
guide.step6_desc: Ensure that the gdpr/logs/ folder has write permissions (755 or 775) on your server to allow the legal saving of proof of consent.
guide.step7_desc: After installation, use the built-in system check tool to verify permissions and security settings.
guide.legal_disclaimer_text: Use of this module does not automatically guarantee GDPR compliance. Compliance depends on the entire site configuration, privacy policy, and data handling practices. Always consult with a legal expert.
guide.pass_recovery_text: If you forget your admin password, simply delete the line starting with $gdpr_admin_pass in your gdpr/config.php file. Access will revert to the default: password.

tech.title: Compliance & Technical Description
tech.intro: This page describes how the system manages consent in compliance with current regulations.
tech.gdpr_desc: The system is designed to comply with GDPR (EU Regulation 2016/679) and the ePrivacy Directive (Cookie Law):
tech.gdpr_point1: Prior Consent: No non-essential cookies are installed before user action.
tech.gdpr_point2: Granularity: Users can choose which categories to activate.
tech.gdpr_point3: Revocability: Consent can be changed at any time via the floating button.
tech.gdpr_point4: Transparency: Direct link to the full policy and clear details in the banner.
tech.gcm_desc: The system natively implements GCM v2 in Basic Mode:
tech.gcm_adv: The tracking script is completely blocked at the source and only loaded after consent. This ensures that no data (not even anonymous pings) is sent before acceptance, meeting the most restrictive compliance requirements.
tech.impl_storage: Storage: Preferences are saved in a local cookie (madness_gdpr_consent) with configurable duration.
tech.impl_events: Events: The gdpr-consent-updated JavaScript event is triggered upon consent change.
tech.impl_blocking: Script Blocking: The system blocks the execution of tracking scripts (e.g., GA4) until it receives a positive consent signal.
tech.proof_desc: The system generates a unique Consent ID and logs it to secure server-side files, including Timestamp and masked IP (Anonymized), as required by law to demonstrate compliance.
tech.generic_desc:
To block third-party scripts (e.g., Facebook Pixel, LinkedIn) that do not support Consent Mode, modify them as follows:
<script type='text/plain' data-category='marketing'>...</script>. They will execute only after consent.
tech.legal_disclaimer_tech: This document and module are for technical reference only. Compliance must be verified by a legal professional.
tech.licensing_text: The system is distributed under the Apache License 2.0. This protects the author from liability and ensures the software can be used in both commercial and open-source projects safely.
tech.security_li1: Password Hashing: Passwords are stored using password_hash() (Bcrypt) to prevent exposure.
tech.security_li2: Log Protection: The logs/ directory is secured via an .htaccess file that denies all direct web access.
tech.security_li3: IP Anonymization: To comply with GDPR data minimization, the last octet of IPv4 (and first 3 blocks of IPv6) are masked before logging.
